wikipedia_page.main: Sir Frank Brian Smedley (28 November 1934 – 6 April 2007) was a High Court judge in the Queen's Bench Division from 1995 to 2000.  As a circuit judge, he took charge of the prosecution of the Matrix Churchill trial in 1992.

response: * Sir Brian Smedley, Judge, taught here briefly in 1957Sir Brian Smedley Obituary The Times, 10 May 2007. Retrieved 14 August 2007

The trial started on Monday, 30 January 1989 at the Old Bailey in central London. The judge was Brian Smedley, Michael Worsley was the prosecuting barrister, and Geoffrey Robertson and Francis Irwin were the defence barristers. On 6 February 1989, the charge of public nuisance was dismissed.  On Tuesday, 9 February 1989, the jury of 10 women and 2 men found Gibson and Sylveire guilty of outraging public decency. Gibson was fined £500 and Sylveire was fined £300.
